title: Re: Everything Is Illuminated: Protecting Ukraine’s Jewish Cemeteries Amidst War
text:
|
|
Thank you, Steven, for this powerful but painful article, and for praising Foer's book. When I went to Ukraine in 2006, I visited Lvov, Zbarazh, Skalat, Chernivitsi (formerly Czernowitz), and Tarnopol, my ancestral towns, and was escorted by Alex Dunai, a terrific guide. One of my goals was to see the towering cenotaph for Zbarazh, which I had found online, and begins "Here Lies Soap." But when I showed Alex a photograph of it, he said it wasn't in Zbarazh; it had been erected by survivors in 1947 and was in Beth David Cemetery in Elmont NY - barely one hour from my house (!)
I describe my Ukrainian visits and subsequent trip to Beth David extensively in BECAUSE OF EVA: A Jewish Genealogical Journey (pub by Syracuse U Press, 2016). Parts, including "Here Lies Soap," were also published over the years in the Forward, the Jewish Week of New York, and The Galizianer.
Susan J. Gordon
New York
ZBARAZH - Bialazurker, Geist, Schoenhaut
SKALAT - Schoenhaut
LVOV - Lempert
CHERNIVITSI - Lempert
